Add header and footer graphics, related markup, styles

Add JavaScript for hiding and showing form confirmation
Fix confirmation page opening in a new tab in Firefox by adding name attribute to hidden iframe
Add basic styling to form elements
Add FontSpring-generated fonts and css; update typograhy to make it work

Make merge propagate props back to both replicas

This fixes an issue where the utime of the conflicting files is kept
at the original utime in each replica even though a successful merge
has occurred. Moreover, the archives are correctly updated to the utime
of the merged file (workingarch), which results in a spurious pending
props change on at least one of the replicas to restore the incorrect
utime (the archive has the correct utime, so the change in utime looks
like a legitimate update).

As a side effect, permissions are also propagated from whatever end up
being the working{1,2} files back to their respective replicas. This
is *not* what we want in general. To resolve this, copyBack should
define newprops as propsTo (as before), but update not only the length
(as before), but also the utime. Unfortunately, the Props and Fileinfo
interfaces don't allow this easily right now and I didn't want to make
major changes.
commit_list.repo_description: Fork of Unison File Synchronizer

commit_list.message:
Ignoring Unison temp files in update_changes

This is to resolve locking race conditions when two or more Unison syncs with
-repeat=watch are happening concurrently using a shared path, for example in
a hub and spoke topology.
commit_list.repo_description: Fork of Unison File Synchronizer

commit_list.message:
Fix indentation in fsmonitor.py to 4 spaces

Also remove trailing spaces
commit_list.repo_description: Fork of Unison File Synchronizer

commit_list.message:
Get fsmonitor.py working for win32

Output relative paths; sleep in master thread to not busy-wait for keyboard
interrupt; open change file in binary mode as a way to output UNIX newlines
even in Windows (which Unison expects); catch exceptions for
ReadDirectoryChangesW; use os.sep instead of '/' for path separator in shared
functions
